# Chris Kurdziel

> Technology investor and operator based in the NYC area. Writes about gaming, crypto, media, startups, and the open internet.

## Who is Chris Kurdziel?

Chris Kurdziel is a technology investor and operator with over 10 years of product leadership at places like Vimeo, Samsung, and various startups. He has led investments in gaming, crypto, and creative technology at Mirana Ventures, Samsung NEXT Ventures, Joyance Partners, and SocialStarts. Portfolio companies include General Intuition/Medal.tv, Aimlabs, Eternal, XMTP, Forte, Filecoin, The Block, Dapper Labs, and PlayVS.

Before investing, he was Director of Product Management at Vimeo (via the acquisition of VHX.tv). His startup origins trace to 2011 when he moved to New York to build Shelby.tv (TechStars NY '11), which was acquired by Samsung in 2014.

He studied at Vanderbilt University and Cornell University.

## Site

- [About](https://chriskurdziel.com/about/): Background, interests, and career history
- [Writing](https://chriskurdziel.com/category/writing): Blog posts on tech, gaming, crypto, media, and startups
- [Investments](https://chriskurdziel.com/category/investments): Portfolio companies

## Topics he writes about

- Gaming (Roblox, esports, the future of interactive media)
- Crypto and web3 (decentralized networks, NFTs, digital ownership)
- Media and video (streaming, content distribution, the creator economy)
- Startups and venture capital (fundraising, company building, ethics in tech)
- The open internet (RSS, decentralization, rewilding the web)

## Interests

- Gaming (DOTA2, game design, esports, the gaming industry)
- Playing guitar
- Travel and the outdoors
- The open internet and decentralization
- Creative technology and tools for creators
